# Introduction to R

- R is a programming language and software environment for statistical computing and graphics.
- It was developed by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman in 1993.
- It is open-source and freely available for use.
- R has become a popular tool for data analysis, data visualization, and machine learning.

## Overview of R and its features

- R is designed for data analysis and statistical computing.
- It has a vast library of packages for various data analysis tasks.
- R has a command-line interface and can be extended with graphical user interfaces like RStudio.
- R has capabilities for data manipulation, visualization, modeling, and reporting.

## Setting up R environment

- R can be downloaded from the official website (www.r-project.org).
- It is available for Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems.
- After installation, R can be run from the command line or a graphical user interface like RStudio.

## Setting up R Studio

- RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R.
- It provides a user-friendly interface for working with R.
RStudio has many features, including code highlighting, debugging, and package management.
- RStudio can be downloaded from the official website (www.rstudio.com).

## R and R Studio

- R is a programming language and software environment for statistical computing and graphics.
- RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) for R.
- R provides a command-line interface, while RStudio provides a graphical user interface.
- R is used for data analysis and statistical computing, while RStudio is used for developing and managing R code.
